body_html:
Not sure if this can be caused by anaconda vs python version mismatch. But to me more and more this looks like an anaconda bug, as with python (native) python(virtualenv) it all works fine.

The only thing I am not sure is, your OS.
I can see that _cudnn_rnn_ops.so is there for you, so it should be accessible. The only reason it wont would be permissions or your OS not being able to read it, but I have not come accross that before.

The only thing I am not sure is, your OS.

body:
Not sure if this can be caused by anaconda vs python version mismatch. But to me more and more this looks like an anaconda bug, as with python (native) python(virtualenv) it all works fine.

The only thing I am not sure is, your OS.
I can see that `_cudnn_rnn_ops.so` is there for you, so it should be accessible. The only reason it wont would be permissions or your OS not being able to read it, but I have not come accross that before.
